dsl.description: The version of the DSL used by the workflow.

tags.description: A key/value mapping of the workflow's tags, if any.
tags.title: DocumentTags

cron.description: Specifies the schedule using a cron expression, e.g., '0 0 * * *' for daily at midnight."

if.description: A runtime expression, if any, used to determine whether or not the task should be run.

operationRef.description: A reference to the AsyncAPI operation to call.

server.description: A a reference to the server to call the specified AsyncAPI operation on. If not set, default to the first server matching the operation's channel.

message.description: The name of the message to use. If not set, defaults to the first message defined by the operation.

binding.description: The name of the binding to use. If not set, defaults to the first binding defined by the operation.

payload.description: The payload to call the AsyncAPI operation with, if any.

authentication.description: The authentication policy, if any, to use when calling the AsyncAPI operation.
authentication.title: CallAsyncAPIWithAuthentication

with.description: Defines the AsyncAPI call to perform.
with.title: CallAsyncAPIWith

name.description: The name of the GRPC service to call.

host.description: The hostname of the GRPC service to call.

port.description: The port number of the GRPC service to call.

authentication.description: The endpoint's authentication policy, if any.
authentication.title: CallGRPCWithServiceAuthentication

method.description: The name of the method to call on the defined GRPC service.

arguments.description: The arguments, if any, to call the method with.
arguments.title: CallGRPCWithArguments

with.description: Defines the GRPC call to perform.
with.title: CallGRPCWith

method.description: The HTTP method of the HTTP request to perform.

endpoint.description: The HTTP endpoint to send the request to.
endpoint.title: CallHTTPWithEndpoint

headers.description: A name/value mapping of the headers, if any, of the HTTP request to perform.

body.description: The body, if any, of the HTTP request to perform.

output.description: The http call output format. Defaults to 'content'.

with.description: Defines the HTTP call to perform.
with.title: CallHTTPWith

operationId.description: The id of the OpenAPI operation to call.

parameters.description: A name/value mapping of the parameters of the OpenAPI operation to call.
parameters.title: CallOpenAPIWithParameters

authentication.description: The authentication policy, if any, to use when calling the OpenAPI operation.
authentication.title: CallOpenAPIWithAuthentication

output.description: The http call output format. Defaults to 'content'.

with.description: Defines the OpenAPI call to perform.
with.title: CallOpenAPIWith

call.description: The name of the function to call.

with.description: A name/value mapping of the parameters, if any, to call the function with.
with.title: CallFunctionWith

forkTask.description: Allows workflows to execute multiple tasks concurrently and optionally race them against each other, with a single possible winner, which sets the task's output.
forkTask.title: ForkTask

compete.description: Indicates whether or not the concurrent tasks are racing against each other, with a single possible winner, which sets the composite task's output.

doTask.description: Allows to execute a list of tasks in sequence
doTask.title: DoTask

emitTask.description: Allows workflows to publish events to event brokers or messaging systems, facilitating communication and coordination between different components and services.
emitTask.title: EmitTask

source.description: Identifies the context in which an event happened

type.description: This attribute contains a value describing the type of event related to the originating occurrence.

datacontenttype.description: Content type of data value. This attribute enables data to carry any type of content, whereby format and encoding might differ from that of the chosen event format.

forTask.description: Allows workflows to iterate over a collection of items, executing a defined set of subtasks for each item in the collection. This task type is instrumental in handling scenarios such as batch processing, data transformation, and repetitive operations across datasets.
forTask.title: ForTask

each.description: The name of the variable used to store the current item being enumerated.

in.description: A runtime expression used to get the collection to enumerate.

at.description: The name of the variable used to store the index of the current item being enumerated.

while.description: A runtime expression that represents the condition, if any, that must be met for the iteration to continue.

listenTask.description: Provides a mechanism for workflows to await and react to external events, enabling event-driven behavior within workflow systems.
listenTask.title: ListenTask

runTask.description: Provides the capability to execute external containers, shell commands, scripts, or workflows.
runTask.title: RunTask

image.description: The name of the container image to run.

command.description: The command, if any, to execute on the container

ports.description: The container's port mappings, if any.

volumes.description: The container's volume mappings, if any.

environment.description: A key/value mapping of the environment variables, if any, to use when running the configured process.

oneOf.description: Enables the execution of external processes encapsulated within a containerized environment.

language.description: The language of the script to run.

environment.description: A key/value mapping of the environment variables, if any, to use when running the configured process.
environment.title: RunTaskRunScriptEnvironment

oneOf.description: Enables the execution of custom scripts or code within a workflow, empowering workflows to perform specialized logic, data processing, or integration tasks by executing user-defined scripts written in various programming languages.

arguments.description: A list of the arguments of the shell command to run.
arguments.title: RunTaskRunShellArguments

environment.description: A key/value mapping of the environment variables, if any, to use when running the configured process.
environment.title: RunTaskRunShellEnvironment

oneOf.description: Enables the execution of shell commands within a workflow, enabling workflows to interact with the underlying operating system and perform system-level operations, such as file manipulation, environment configuration, or system administration tasks.

namespace.description: The namespace the workflow to run belongs to.

name.description: The name of the workflow to run.

version.description: The version of the workflow to run. Defaults to latest

input.description: The data, if any, to pass as input to the workflow to execute. The value should be validated against the target workflow's input schema, if specified.
input.title: RunTaskRunWorkflowInput

oneOf.description: Enables the invocation and execution of nested workflows within a parent workflow, facilitating modularization, reusability, and abstraction of complex logic or business processes by encapsulating them into standalone workflow units.

setTask.description: A task used to set data
setTask.title: SetTask

switchTask.description: Enables conditional branching within workflows, allowing them to dynamically select different paths based on specified conditions or criteria
switchTask.title: SwitchTask

when.description: A runtime expression used to determine whether or not the case matches.

tryTask.description: Serves as a mechanism within workflows to handle errors gracefully, potentially retrying failed tasks before proceeding with alternate ones.
tryTask.title: TryTask

as.description: The name of the runtime expression variable to save the error as. Defaults to 'error'.

when.description: A runtime expression used to determine whether or not to catch the filtered error

exceptWhen.description: A runtime expression used to determine whether or not to catch the filtered error

waitTask.description: Allows workflows to pause or delay their execution for a specified period of time.
waitTask.title: WaitTask

authority.description: The URI that references the OAuth2 authority to use.

secret.description: The client secret to use, if any.

scopes.description: The scopes, if any, to request the token for.

audiences.description: The audiences, if any, to request the token for.

username.description: The username to use. Used only if the grant type is Password.

password.description: The password to use. Used only if the grant type is Password.

token.description: The security token to use to use.

type.description: The type of the security token to use to use.
A URI reference that identifies the error type.

status.description: The status code generated by the origin for this occurrence of the error.

instance.description: A JSON Pointer used to reference the component the error originates from.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the error.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the error.

all.description: A list containing all the events that must be consumed.
all.title: EventConsumptionStrategyAll

any.description: A list containing any of the events to consume.
any.title: EventConsumptionStrategyAny

source.description: Identifies the context in which an event happened

type.description: This attribute contains a value describing the type of event related to the originating occurrence.

datacontenttype.description: Content type of data value. This attribute enables data to carry any type of content, whereby format and encoding might differ from that of the chosen event format.

with.description: An event filter is a mechanism used to selectively process or handle events based on predefined criteria, such as event type, source, or specific attributes.
with.title: EventFilterWith

from.description: A runtime expression used to extract the correlation value from the filtered event.

expect.description: A constant or a runtime expression, if any, used to determine whether or not the extracted correlation value matches expectations. If not set, the first extracted value will be used as the correlation's expectation.

correlate.description: A correlation is a link between events and data, established by mapping event attributes to specific data attributes, allowing for coordinated processing or handling based on event characteristics.
correlate.title: EventFilterCorrelate

eventFilter.description: An event filter is a mechanism used to selectively process or handle events based on predefined criteria, such as event type, source, or specific attributes.
eventFilter.title: EventFilter

extend.description: The type of task to extend.

when.description: A runtime expression, if any, used to determine whether or not the extension should apply in the specified context.

extension.description: The definition of a an extension.
extension.title: Extension

name.description: The external resource's name, if any.

from.description: A runtime expression, if any, used to mutate and/or filter the input of the workflow or task.

input.description: Configures the input of a workflow or task.
input.title: Input

as.description: A runtime expression, if any, used to mutate and/or filter the output of the workflow or task.

output.description: Configures the output of a workflow or task.
output.title: Output

as.description: A runtime expression, if any, used to export the output data to the context.

export.description: Set the content of the context.
export.title: Export

when.description: A runtime expression, if any, used to determine whether or not to retry running the task, in a given context.

exceptWhen.description: A runtime expression used to determine whether or not to retry running the task, in a given context.

constant.description: The definition of the constant backoff to use, if any.

exponential.description: The definition of the exponential backoff to use, if any.

linear.description: The definition of the linear backoff to use, if any.

count.description: The maximum amount of retry attempts, if any.

jitter.description: The parameters, if any, that control the randomness or variability of the delay between retry attempts.
jitter.title: RetryPolicyJitter

format.description: The schema's format. Defaults to 'json'. The (optional) version of the format can be set using `{format}:{version}`.

schema.description: Represents the definition of a schema.
schema.title: Schema
